name: magnolia
text: I think people finding out their crap isn't worth anything on Antiques Roadshow is the saddest thing.

name: apocowarg
text: Taking pain medication and watching Antiques Roadshow is possibly the most soothing activity. Ever since Bob Ross died.

name: greyfield
text: Finding a dead body with a wrench in his head on Antiques Roadshow is the saddest thing.

name: ph3r
text: People finding out that their crap is on Antiques Roadshow on Law and Order is the saddest thing.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Well, maybe they should. Hush!

name: deimosrising
text: I would watch Antiques road show religiously if I knew there was a secret rerun that appeared only one in every 1000 airings in which a man was killed with a wrench

name: spinynorman
text:
There's a wide variety of shows and advertisements that could improve with dead bodies or brutality.

Like one would be a commercial with a brutal fight between these two guys, all Bourne identity gritty handheld action, and one guy is slamming the other's head up against the corner of the wall, his eyes all rolling back in his head, and then he slams him into the toilet. The man struggles, screaming, but the attacker keeps striking his head, holding him down, crimson blossoming through the toilet bowl water from his face...

The struggling stops. The victor holds him down longer, then steps back, breathing heavily, streaked in blood.

Then he grins real big, looks right at the camera, picks his right knee up and holds an imaginary glass and HE'S GOT A LITTLE CAPTAIN IN HIM

CAPTAIN MORGAN'S SPICED RUM

drink responsibly

name: baryonyx
text:
Damn.

That deserves more chubbies than it has been awarded.

name: tekende
text:
That is hard.

That is COMPLETELY RAW.

name: idsyen
text:
That

is

RUUUUUUUDE

name: dismas
text: So I just tried to give this comment a chubby, again, not realizing that I did that the last time I read through all of the Achewood archives.  Well done, sir.  Good show.

name: zem
text: I love this strip

name: bron
text: How much could a dead person with a wrench in his head go for?

name: spectre
text: I dunno, check "EBay Platinum Reserve".

name: unquotable
text: good one

name: bixschmix
text: It depends. Is it a Neo-Victorian gold-filigreed wrench originally used by Andrew Carnegie?

name: cuddlefish
text: depends on how old he is

name: ambala
text: Phillipe has excellent posture.

name: jdhenry105
text: And a complete inability to change his facial expression.

name: steev_dayv
text: Call on meeeeeeeeee!

name: untilyouaresonude
text:
Antiques Roadshow Guy with ponytail and flippant shirt: "This wrench was actually one of the first made by Craftsman select. Were it any other wrench, this would only bring about $100 at auction. Luckily, due to the nature of the wrench and the fact that this guy is a descendent Zachary Taylor, this would bring between four and five-thousand dollars at auction."

Underwhelmed White Woman: "Oh, my! Thank you!"

name: saint
text: i was totally picturing this entire scene in my head.

name: closefriend
text: There was a kid in my fifth-grade class who was a descendant of Zachary Taylor. Unless puberty really, really changed him I could see him getting whacked from blunt-force trauma involving a wrench.

name: closefriend
text: (Or at least a bad encounter with cherries.)

name: farqussus
text: I'm picturing Zachary Ty Brian

name: saint
text:
My avatar is Zachary Quinto.

Sorry..I tried.

name: straw
text:
I read it too quickly the first time around and thought you said "Jonathan Taylor"

That would have been better, personally, for me as I enjoy the image of Jonathan Taylor Thomas with a wrench in his head.

name: stuart
text: the REAL series finale of Home Improvement

name: farqussus
text: i swear i posted before I saw your post. see above.

name: philosophe
text: A comment left by philosophe was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by crumpetsandtea, cbtbone, mattylite)

name: philosophe
text: Excellent post by the way, the use of 'flippant' just kinda took me out of the moment.

name: rowboat
text: End BBcode butchery.

name: steev_dayv
text: A dick about terms.

name: feets
text: Grammar Nazi? Well, you're not the diction police.

name: rapid_roy
text: I wish one L&O episode would open with Antiques Roadshow...then they find a body inside a set of old vases or something.

name: bixschmix
text: An old woman innocently brings in a set of antique Russian nesting dolls to be appraised.. BUT A HORRIBLE SECRET IS DISCOVERED INSIDE

name: coldfrog
text: ...  and they spend the next hour making that secret as boring and litigiously well-defined as possible.

name: mystkmanat
text:
I love your avatar.
The only scary thing about a one-armed man trying to scare someone is the fact that he feels that his one arm is only good for trying to scare somebody.

name: direhaggis
text: They could find an antique dead person with a wrench in his head.

name: hikikomori
text: This dead person with a wrench in his head, if sold at auction, would fetch over six hundred million dollars .

name: deusoma
text: Gotta give you a chubby, because the bold absolutely makes that, and no editing often makes me chicken out of using formatting.

name: tekende
text: I first read that as "no ending makes me chuckle out of using formatting." When I started to read it correctly it really confused me for a while. Man I want to go home now.

name: spectre
text: That's gotta be the worst acting gig in New York . . . the dead person before the credits roll on Law and Order. You don't even get 15 full minutes of fame.

name: molesticide
text:
nor do you speak, so you ain't get no fucking sag card either,

C H U M P

name: clever-nickname
text: just yesterday, i told my friend that every single episode of Law and Order starts the same way: 1. person or group of people is walking or doing something. 2. they stumble upon a somewhat hidden corpse. 3. one of them mutters "oh my god..." under their breath. 4. it cuts to a scene of the coroner explaining the death.

name: tekende
text: By contrast, CSI always begins with a scene set to a rock song in which someone dies or is running from a murder scene or murderer. Usually something very bizarre is going on. Then the CSI field guys examine the scene. The autopsy usually does not occur until after the first commercial break.

name: farqussus
text: You forgot the horrific pun about the manner of death.

name: stereo
text: This corpse leaves me... wrenching in my throat!

name: theguitarhero
text:
The killer really threw a wrench in this guy's plans.

(Removes sunglasses)

(cut to shot of David Caruso and a cast of pretty people doing things one would do in Miami, like airboating and sunbathing, while The Who plays over the opening credits)

YEAAAAAAAAAAAAAH bum bum bum I WON'T GET FOOLED AGAIN!!!!

name: doomchild
text:
"Cause of death was blunt force trauma to the base of the skull. The weapon was a an adjustable pipe wrench. Guy was dead before he hit the floor."

Lennie Briscoe turns around as Ed Green looks on.

"Poor guy wrenched his occipital lobe."

Fade to black.

name: theguitarhero
text:
WHERE THE FUCK IS WALLACE, STRING? HE HAS MY WRENCH.

Way dooown in the hole...

name: kobraski
text: oh, this is so sweet.

name: relaxing
text: I got a signed copy of this strip.

name: slalvation
text: This perfectly summarizes my own inner conflict. (people happy forever vs. people dead with wrenches in their heads)

name: tbtabby
text: That last panel is really all this comic needs.

name: neitherman
text: I want to take a rusty spatula I grabbed out of my kitchen drawer and have them tell me it's from Kmart.

name: brynito
text:
I bet PBS's rating would go through the roof if they found that snooty blonde lady with a wrench in her head on the show. Like in an old steamer case. Maybe if they were all nude? Naked Antiques Roadshow?
I am not sure if I would want to watch.

name: hamscout
text: Just ONCE could they find a headless corpse in the hand carved early American hope chest that they found in the back of their dead mother's ratty old cottage??

name: em2
text: Law & Order: SAWVU (Special Antique Wrench Victims Unit)

name: expellens
text:
It is telling that my ex-wife would also shush me when Law & Order came on.

and then flip me off...

name: azmap1
text: oh yeah expellens, you're gonna end up someday with a wrench in your head, I can just tell...

name: sparhawk
text:
Both shows speak to my soul in a low whisper; they speak to me of immutability, of inevitability, stale air in a tiny chamber, the gaoler changes your water, stares at you through the bars.

This jug may be worth as much as four dollars and a receipt for tampons.

name: scorpionbyte
text: ha

name: radarjammer
text: First "Dammit-Achewood-made-me-laugh-in-an-innapropriate-situation" Achewood.

name: puguglypress
text: So I guess back in the day nobody had facial expressions.
